metadata.title: CVE-2013-1923 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
rpc-gssd in nfs-utils before 1.2.8 performs reverse DNS resolution forserver names during GSSAPI authentication, which might allow remoteattackers to read otherwise-restricted files via DNS spoofing attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nfs-common - 1:1.2.8-6ubuntu4
nfs-kernel-server - 1:1.2.8-6ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nfs-utils package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.8-6ubuntu4').
